title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.31 | 20-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshuran Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pachatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deviim Saraswatiim Vyasam
Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 31st verse of the 11th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Patnya ha patim proshya grhanu paat gatam
Vilokya sanjata mano mahot savaha
Uttastur aarat sahasa asana shayat
Sakam vratayal vridita lochananana ha
the meaning of this verse is the queens of lord sri krishna rejoiced within their minds
to see their husband home after a long period abroad the queens got up at once from their
seats and meditations as was socially customary they covered their faces shyly and looked about
coyly so here is a description when krishna entered the palaces
he expanded himself into 16108 forms and simultaneously he entered each of the palaces
so when he was in his home he is available to each and every queen simultaneously
unlike the living entities of this world or even of the spiritual world
at least in this world a yogi can expand himself into maximum 10 forms
krishna expanded himself into as many forms as required
so therefore nobody can imitate krishna nobody can duplicate krishna
so krishna is the supreme unlimited uh personality of godhead
and the queens when they saw the supreme lord their husband their beloved husband entering the
palace they at once got up from their seats and meditations but they were also shy so they were
very shy
so they looked through the covering in a shy manner
so sri lak prabhupada explains elaborately in the purport a very important point
the lord entered his home palaces occupied by 16108 queens this means the lord at once expanded himself in as many forms as possible
the lord entered his home palaces occupied by 16108 queens this means the lord at once expanded himself in as much as he could
the lord at once expanded himself in as much as he could
as many plenary expansions as there were queens and palaces and entered in each
and every one of them simultaneously and separately here is another manifestation
of the feature of his internal potency he can expand himself in as many forms
of spiritual identity as he desires even though he is one without a second God is
one but that one Supreme Lord expands himself in plenary expansions plenary
means with full power in each of the forms that he expands his form is power
is not diminished it is confirmed in a Shruti mantra that the absolute is one
alone a come a va-advitiya and yet he becomes many as soon as he so desires
these may be the same as the other shrutis and shrutis do not have the soul
these may be the same as the other shrutis and shrutis do not have the soul
manifold expansions of the Supreme Lord are manifested as plenary and separated portions.
The separated portions are representations of his energy and
the plenary portions are manifestations of his personality.
The technical point
Krishna
expands himself
his own
personality in plenary portions.
Full power each of the plenary expansions.
Like Krishna, Rama, Narasimha, Varaha, Narayana, Govinda.
All of them have same power. All of them are the Supreme Lord. The same Supreme Lord. One and only Supreme Lord.
Whereas he has got energies and
expansions of the energies are called
separated expansions.
They are not plenary expansions. That means there is gradation of power
in each of the expansions of the
energy.
As much as is required for the purpose
of the expansion of the energy, only that much power will be present in the expanded portion.
Separated expansion.
Thus the personality of God had manifested himself in
16,108 plenary expansions and
simultaneously entered into each and every one of the palaces of the Queens.
This is called Vaibhava or the Transcendental Potency of the Lord.
This is the technical word Vaibhava.
It means this is the spiritual potency or transcendental potency of the Lord.
Because he can do so, he is known as Yogeshwara.
In the level of the Lord, he is known as Yogeshwara.
In the eleventh chapter, it is described
Krishna as Yogeshwara.
18th chapter.
yatra Yogeshwara Krishna yatra partho dhanur dharaha tatra sri vijayo bhutir dhruvanitir matir mama
Krishna is Yogeshwara. He has got unlimited
siddhis,
unlimited siddhis.
Ordinarily, a yogi or mystic living being is able to expand himself at
the most to tenfold expansions of his body at most ten expansions
but the lord can do so to the extent of as many thousands or infinitely as he likes
unbelievers become astonished to learn that lord krishna married more than 16 000 queens
because they think of lord krishna as one of them and measure the potency of the lord by
their own limited potency never make this mistake don't think krishna is like another
ordinary living being no he is the supreme lord infinitely powerful infinitely expanded
one should therefore know that the lord is never on the level of the living beings
and these living beings are but expansions of his marginal potency
krishna
has got one potency called tatastha shakti marginal potency and living beings are expansions
of this tatastha shakti one should also never equalize the potent and the potency
krishna is the potent the possessor of the potency and the potency is
the energy of krishna the potency of krishna energy of krishna so don't equalize the possessor
of the potency
all the potencies krishna one supreme lord with the potency itself don't equalize
as far as the quality is concerned there is not much difference between the quality
of the potent and the potency both are spiritual the queens were also expansions of his internal
potency
internal potency the queens and thus the potent and the potencies are perpetually exchanging
transcendental pleasures known as the pastimes of the lord krishna leela ram leela narsimha leela
varaha leela that is the term used only for the lord his transcendental pastimes exchanged between
the potency and the potent
one should not therefore become astonished to learn that the lord married so many wives
on the contrary one should affirm that even the lord lord marries 16 000 million wives
he is not completely manifesting his unlimited and inexhaustible potency
because he is unlimited that's a fact
he is not completely manifesting his unlimited and inexhaustible potency
because he is unlimited that's a fact
that's a fact
he married only sixteen thousand wives and entered in each and every one of them
in different palaces just to impress in the history of the human beings on the surface of
the earth that the lord is never equal to or less than any human being however powerful a human
being might be no one therefore is either equal to or greater than the lord the lord is
always great in all respects God is great is eternal truth therefore as soon
as the Queen saw from a distance their husband was away from home for long
periods due to the Battle of Kurukshetra they all arose from the slumber of
meditation and prepared to receive their most beloved see even in Krishna is away
from the palace the Queen's are engaged in meditating on Krishna constantly they
cannot forget even for a fraction of a moment none they're so attached they're
so pleased to always think of him Krishna says that in the Bhagavad Gita
man mana always think of me so the Queen's and all the devotees not only
the Queen's all the devotees in the spiritual world
are always thinking of Krishna every moment thinking of Krishna and thereby
being very much satisfied and full of bliss transcendental pure bliss
according to Yajnavalkya's religious injunctions a woman whose husband is
away from home should not take part in
his social functions should not decorate her body should not laugh and should not
go to any relatives house in any circumstance this is a Vedic culture
scriptural directions also this is the vow of the ladies whose husbands are
away from home at the same time it is also enjoined that a wife should never
present herself before the husband in unclean state she must decorate herself
with ornaments and good dress and should always be present
before the husband in a happy and joyous mood
so what about the queens of varka it is explained the queens of lord
krishna were all in meditation thinking of the lord's absence and were
always meditating upon him the lord's devotees cannot live even for
one moment without meditating on the lord
and what to speak of the queens who are all goddesses of fortune
incarnated as queens in the past times of the lord and varka
are all lakshmi they can never be separated from the lord either by
presence or by trance when krishna is personally present they
are with krishna and when krishna is away
physically away then they are always with lord
by meditation completely absorbed in thinking of him
only now similarly the gopis at vrindavan
could not forget the lord when the lord was away in the forest cowherding
when the lord boy krishna was absent from the village
the gopis at home used to worry about his traversing
the rough ground with his soft lotus feet
by thinking thus
they were sometimes overwhelmed in trance and mortified in the heart
they feel for krishna within their heart every moment
when he's away from home from the village
such is the condition of the pure associates of the lord
they are always in trance and so the queens also were in trance
during the absence of the lord from varka
presently having seen the lord from a distance
they at once gave up all their engagements including the vows as women
described above
so
they actually were overwhelmed with ecstasy upon seeing the lord
and they express that in different ways that we described in the next words
